     2‚Üí  "executor": { "concurrency": 8, "haltOnError": true, "preflight": false, "autoLogin": false, "planning": "none", "strict": true },
     3‚Üí  "nodes": [
     4‚Üí    { "id": "ask_brand", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Brand ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "BRAND_ID" },

     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí    { "id": "step_01_configure_category_vegetables", "title": "Step 1: Configure Stock Category: Vegetables", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories?search=Vegetables" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Vegetables')].id | [0]", "emit": "VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID" },
     8‚Üí    { "id": "step_02_create_category_vegetables", "title": "Step 2: Create Stock Category: Vegetables", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories", "body": { "name": "Vegetables" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_01_configure_category_vegetables"], "when": "{VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID" },
     9‚Üí

    11‚Üí    { "id": "step_04_create_category_soups", "title": "Step 4: Create Stock Category: Soups", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories", "body": { "name": "Soups" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_03_configure_category_soups"], "when": "{SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID" },
    12‚Üí

    14‚Üí    { "id": "step_06_create_uom_each", "title": "Step 6: Create UOM: Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures", "body": { "name": "Each" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_05_configure_uom_each"], "when": "{EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },

    17‚Üí    { "id": "step_08_create_uom_kg", "title": "Step 8: Create UOM: Kilogram", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures", "body": { "name": "Kilogram" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_07_configure_uom_kg"], "when": "{KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },

    20‚Üí    { "id": "step_10_create_supplier", "title": "Step 10: Create Supplier: TEST Supplier", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/suppliers", "body": { "name": "TEST Supplier", "isRegisteredForTax": false, "phone": "011-555-0001", "contactPerson": "Test Manager" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_09_configure_supplier"], "when": "{TEST_SUPPLIER_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "TEST_SUPPLIER_ID" },

    28‚Üí    { "id": "step_16_create_item_potatoes", "title": "Step 16: Create Stock Item: Potatoes", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems", "body": { "name": "Potatoes", "code": "VEG001", "CategoryId": "{VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID}", "unitOfMeasureId": "{KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID}", "processedStockType": 1, "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_07_configure_uom_kg", "step_01_configure_category_vegetables", "step_13_configure_item_potatoes"], "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí    { "id": "step_17_configure_item_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 17: Configure Stock Item: Potatoe Soup - Soups, Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoe%20Soup" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoe Soup')].id | [0]", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" },

{
  "executor": { "concurrency": 8, "haltOnError": true, "preflight": false, "autoLogin": false, "planning": "none", "strict": true },
  "nodes": [
    { "id": "ask_brand", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Brand ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "BRAND_ID" },
    { "id": "ask_store", "kind": "input.prompt", "message": "Enter Store ID", "type": "integer", "emit": "STORE_ID" },

    { "id": "step_01_configure_category_vegetables", "title": "Step 1: Configure Stock Category: Vegetables", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories?search=Vegetables" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Vegetables')].id | [0]", "emit": "VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID" },
    { "id": "step_02_create_category_vegetables", "title": "Step 2: Create Stock Category: Vegetables", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories", "body": { "name": "Vegetables" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_01_configure_category_vegetables"], "when": "{VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID" },

    { "id": "step_03_configure_category_soups", "title": "Step 3: Configure Stock Category: Soups", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories?search=Soups" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Soups')].id | [0]", "emit": "SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID" },
    { "id": "step_04_create_category_soups", "title": "Step 4: Create Stock Category: Soups", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockcategories", "body": { "name": "Soups" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_03_configure_category_soups"], "when": "{SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID" },

    { "id": "step_05_configure_uom_each", "title": "Step 5: Configure UOM: Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Each')].id | [0]", "emit": "EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },
    { "id": "step_06_create_uom_each", "title": "Step 6: Create UOM: Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures", "body": { "name": "Each" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_05_configure_uom_each"], "when": "{EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },

    { "id": "step_07_configure_uom_kg", "title": "Step 7: Configure UOM: Kilogram", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Kilogram')].id | [0]", "emit": "KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },
    { "id": "step_08_create_uom_kg", "title": "Step 8: Create UOM: Kilogram", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/unitofmeasures", "body": { "name": "Kilogram" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_07_configure_uom_kg"], "when": "{KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID" },

    { "id": "step_09_configure_supplier", "title": "Step 9: Configure Supplier: TEST Supplier", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/suppliers" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_store"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='TEST Supplier' && @.isRegisteredForTax==false)].id | [0]", "emit": "TEST_SUPPLIER_ID" },
    { "id": "step_10_create_supplier", "title": "Step 10: Create Supplier: TEST Supplier", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/stores/{STORE_ID}/suppliers", "body": { "name": "TEST Supplier", "isRegisteredForTax": false, "phone": "011-555-0001", "contactPerson": "Test Manager" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_09_configure_supplier"], "when": "{TEST_SUPPLIER_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "TEST_SUPPLIER_ID" },

    { "id": "step_11_configure_subcount", "title": "Step 11: Configure Subcount: Test Sub Count", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/subcounts" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand", "ask_store"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Test Sub Count' && @.isArchived==false)].id | [0]", "emit": "TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID" },
    { "id": "step_12_create_subcount", "title": "Step 12: Create Subcount: Test Sub Count", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/subcounts", "body": { "name": "Test Sub Count" } }, "dependsOn": ["step_11_configure_subcount"], "when": "{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID" },

    { "id": "step_13_configure_item_potatoes", "title": "Step 13: Configure Stock Item: Potatoes - Vegetables, KG", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoes" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoes')].id | [0]", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_14_read_wastage_potatoes", "title": "Step 14: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoes) - read", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoes" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoes')].wastagePercentage | [0]", "emit": "POTATOES_WASTAGE" },
    { "id": "step_15_set_wastage_potatoes", "title": "Step 15: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoes) - set if needed", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems/{POTATOES_ITEM_ID}", "body": { "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_13_configure_item_potatoes", "step_14_read_wastage_potatoes"], "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} != null && {POTATOES_WASTAGE} != 0.0", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_16_create_item_potatoes", "title": "Step 16: Create Stock Item: Potatoes", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems", "body": { "name": "Potatoes", "code": "VEG001", "CategoryId": "{VEGETABLES_CATEGORY_ID}", "unitOfMeasureId": "{KILOGRAM_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID}", "processedStockType": 1, "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_07_configure_uom_kg", "step_01_configure_category_vegetables", "step_13_configure_item_potatoes"], "when": "{POTATOES_ITEM_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOES_ITEM_ID" },

    { "id": "step_17_configure_item_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 17: Configure Stock Item: Potatoe Soup - Soups, Each", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoe%20Soup" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoe Soup')].id | [0]", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_18_read_wastage_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 18: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoe Soup) - read", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "GET", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems?search=Potatoe%20Soup" }, "dependsOn": ["ask_brand"], "select": "$.items[?(@.name=='Potatoe Soup')].wastagePercentage | [0]", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_WASTAGE" },
    { "id": "step_19_set_wastage_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 19: Ensure wastage% = 0.0 (Potatoe Soup) - set if needed", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "PUT", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems/{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID}", "body": { "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_17_configure_item_potatoe_soup", "step_18_read_wastage_potatoe_soup"], "when": "{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID} != null && {POTATOE_SOUP_WASTAGE} != 0.0", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" },
    { "id": "step_20_create_item_potatoe_soup", "title": "Step 20: Create Stock Item: Potatoe Soup", "kind": "mcp.call", "server": "cloud", "tool": "call_cloud_api_endpoint", "args": { "method": "POST", "path": "/brands/{BRAND_ID}/stockitems", "body": { "name": "Potatoe Soup", "code": "SOUP001", "CategoryId": "{SOUPS_CATEGORY_ID}", "unitOfMeasureId": "{EACH_UNIT_OF_MEASURE_ID}", "processedStockType": 1, "wastagePercentage": 0.0 } }, "dependsOn": ["step_05_configure_uom_each", "step_03_configure_category_soups", "step_17_configure_item_potatoe_soup"], "when": "{POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID} == null", "select": "$.id", "emit": "POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID" }

     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## üö® MANDATORY EXECUTION RULES - READ BEFORE STARTING üö®
     4‚Üí

If any step or output format is unclear, refer to `_instructions.md` and adhere to it exactly.

    48‚Üí**VALIDATION HANDLING:**

    50‚Üí

    52‚Üí- **NEVER hardcode any ID values** - not 1, not 2, not any number
    53‚Üí- **NEVER assume an ID exists** or is valid

    59‚Üí

    65‚Üí**Instruction:**
    66‚ÜíFor every step or API call in this runbook, display a clear label or description of the task being executed before running the command. This ensures visibility into what is happening at each stage.
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí## Execution: FIFO DAG Suite
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí- Execute the DAGs below in order. Do not infer or reorder.
    71‚Üí- Reuse the same `BRAND_ID` and `STORE_ID` across all DAGs in this run.

    73‚Üí- Do not perform preflight checks or auto-login; the DAG `executor` flags control behavior.

    75‚Üí

    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí### Run Order
    83‚Üí1. `AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json`
    84‚Üí2. `AI/dags/Fifo-02-Sanitise-Test-Area.dag.json`
    85‚Üí3. `AI/dags/Fifo-03-Setup-Test-Data.dag.json`
    86‚Üí4. `AI/dags/Fifo-04-Validation.dag.json`
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí## DAG 1: Configuration - Prerequisites and Base Setup
    89‚Üí
    90‚Üí**üö® MANDATORY STOP RULE: If ANY API call returns an error, 404, or unexpected response, IMMEDIATELY STOP execution and report the exact error. DO NOT continue to the next item. DO NOT move on to other sections. STOP and ask the user how to proceed. üö®**
    91‚Üí
    92‚ÜíThis DAG verifies and creates all required entities for FIFO testing. Complete it before moving on.
    93‚Üí
    94‚Üí### Execute DAG 1
    95‚Üí- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json`.
    96‚Üí- It will prompt for `BRAND_ID` and `STORE_ID` and then configure:
    97‚Üí    - Unit of Measures: Each, Kilogram
    98‚Üí    - Stock Categories: Vegetables, Soups
    99‚Üí    - Supplier: TEST Supplier (isRegisteredForTax = false)
   100‚Üí    - Subcount: Test Sub Count (not archived)
   101‚Üí    - Stock Items: Potatoes (KG, Vegetables, wastage 0.0), Potatoe Soup (Each, Soups, wastage 0.0)
   102‚Üí- Outputs: captures all resolved IDs for use in later sections.
   103‚Üí- Re-runnable: safely checks-or-creates and updates wastage when needed.
   104‚Üí
   105‚Üí## DAG 2: Environment Reset - Clean Testing Stage
   106‚Üí
   107‚Üí**üö® MANDATORY EXECUTION PATTERN: MUST use itemIds filter in ALL queries. NEVER archive stock takes or GRVs without itemIds filter. üö®**
   108‚Üí
   109‚ÜíAfter completing DAG 1, execute the DAG `AI/dags/Fifo-02-Sanitise-Test-Area.dag.json` to ensure a clean test environment by removing any existing data for our test items only.
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí### Step: Archive Stock Takes Containing Test Items Only
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí**STEP 1:** Query for stock takes containing ONLY our test items:
   114‚Üí```
   115‚ÜíGET /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes?itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}&isArchived=false
   116‚Üí```
   117‚Üí
   118‚Üí**STEP 2:** For each stock take returned in STEP 1, archive it:
   119‚Üí```
   120‚ÜíPUT /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{STOCK_TAKE_ID}/archive
   121‚Üí```
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí**MANDATORY SAFETY CHECK:** The query in STEP 1 MUST include `itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}` parameter. If this parameter is missing, STOP EXECUTION immediately.
   124‚Üí
   125‚Üí### Step: Archive GRVs Containing Test Items Only
   126‚Üí
   127‚Üí**STEP 1:** Query for GRVs containing ONLY our test items (no date filters):
   128‚Üí```
   129‚ÜíGET /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs?itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}&isArchived=false
   130‚Üí```
   131‚Üí- **CRITICAL**: The itemIds parameter MUST be included to filter only GRVs with our test items
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí**STEP 2:** Collect GRV IDs from the response and archive them in bulk:
   134‚Üí```
   135‚ÜíPUT /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/archive
   136‚Üí```
   137‚ÜíRequest body: `{"grvIds": [array of GRV IDs from STEP 1]}`
   138‚Üí
   139‚Üí**MANDATORY SAFETY CHECK:** Only archive GRVs that were returned with the itemIds filter. NEVER archive all GRVs.
   140‚Üí
   141‚Üí### Step: Verify Clean State
   142‚Üí- **Check FIFO report returns empty for our test items:**
   143‚Üí    - GET `/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/theoretical-stockonhand?items={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}`
   144‚Üí    - Should return empty theoreticalSOH array, confirming no existing FIFO data for test items
   145‚Üí
   146‚Üí## DAG 3: Setup Test Data (Deterministic)
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí### Execute DAG 3
   149‚Üí- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-03-Setup-Test-Data.dag.json`.
   150‚Üí- It will create deterministic test data only:
   151‚Üí    - Create a single Stock Take at 7 days ago UTC, set Potatoes to 100.0 kg, post it
   152‚Üí    - Create a GRV after that stock take for Potatoes and receive it
   153‚Üí- Outputs: captures `STOCK_TAKE_1_ID`, `GRV_ID`, `GRV_ITEM_ID` for later use.
   154‚Üí
   155‚Üí### Date Mapping (MANDATORY DISPLAY)
   156‚ÜíBefore running the DAG, print the resolved dates (from current date) and label their usage:
   157‚Üí- Stock Take date: `{7_DAYS_AGO}`
   158‚Üí- GRV date: `{6_DAYS_AGO}` (receive uses `{6_DAYS_AGO_YYYYMMDDHHMMSS}`)
   159‚Üí
   160‚Üí## DAG 4: FIFO Validation Testing
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí### Execute DAG 4
   163‚Üí- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-04-Validation.dag.json`.
   164‚Üí- This DAG performs comprehensive FIFO validation testing:
   165‚Üí    - Tests Theoretical Stock On Hand reports with expected values
   166‚Üí    - Creates closing stock take with 80kg remaining stock
   167‚Üí    - Generates and validates Gross Profit reports with multi-layered FIFO calculations
   168‚Üí    - Creates test discard data for spoilage testing
   169‚Üí    - Generates and validates Stock Loss reports
   170‚Üí- Expected validation results:
   171‚Üí    - TSOH: opening=100, purchases=100, theoreticalSOH=200
   172‚Üí    - GP Report: Multi-layered FIFO test (Opening=100kg@R150, Purchases=100kg@R300, Closing=80kg, Consumed=120kg@R210)
   173‚Üí    - Stock Loss: spoilageUnits=5.0, spoilageValue=5.0, differenceValue=210.0
   174‚Üí- All validation steps must pass to confirm FIFO calculations are working correctly

file.content:
# FIFO Stock Management Testing Runbook

## üö® MANDATORY EXECUTION RULES - READ BEFORE STARTING üö®

**CRITICAL:** A stock take is NOT complete until all three steps are executed. An empty stock take or unposted stock take is useless for testing.

**CRITICAL SAFETY RULES:**
1. **ALWAYS use itemIds filter when querying stock takes**: `?itemIds=7313,7314&isArchived=false`
2. **NEVER execute archive operations without itemIds filter** 
3. **STOP IMMEDIATELY if any API call is missing required parameters**
4. **Each DAG MUST be completed before moving to the next DAG**
5. **If ANY step fails, STOP and report exact error - DO NOT CONTINUE**

**DEFAULT TEST VALUES (remove when testing complete):**
- Brand ID: 46
- Store ID: 10810
- Test Items: 7313 (Potatoes), 7314 (Potatoe Soup)

**MANDATORY DATE RULE:** 
- **CRITICAL**: When executing DAGs, ALWAYS use the dates specified in the DAG file defaults section, NOT dynamic dates
- If a DAG has hardcoded dates in its "defaults" section, those dates MUST be used exactly as specified
- Only use dynamic dates (7 days ago) if the DAG does NOT specify dates in defaults
- **FORMAT**: All dates must be in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.000Z

**MANDATORY SUMMARY:**
After each API endpoint call, print a brief summary indicating whether the call passed, if an entity already existed, or if it was created. This summary must be clear and concise, before moving to the next API call.

**Example format:**
- "‚úÖ Found existing 'Each' UOM with ID 68 - skipping creation"
- "‚úÖ Created new 'Vegetables' category with ID 123"
- "‚ùå API call failed: 404 Not Found"

**MANDATORY INSTRUCTION:**
This runbook must be executed in strict accordance with the protocols and formatting rules defined in `AI/Runbooks/_instructions.md`. Every instruction in that file is mandatory and must be followed 100%‚Äîno deviations, summarization, or interpretation are permitted. If any step or output format is unclear, refer to `_instructions.md` and adhere to it exactly.

**CRITICAL ERROR HANDLING:**
If ANY API call encounters an error, unexpected response, or failure:
1. HALT execution immediately 
2. Report the exact error message received
3. Report the exact API endpoint that failed
4. Report the exact request data sent
5. **CRITICAL**: If the error indicates connection failure (e.g., "connection refused", "target machine actively refused", "max retries exceeded"), immediately ask the user to verify that the Cloud API service is running and accessible
6. DO NOT attempt workarounds, retries, or alternative approaches
7. DO NOT continue to subsequent steps
8. Bring the issue to the user's attention for resolution
9. Wait for explicit user instruction before proceeding

**VALIDATION HANDLING:**
DAG validation steps should be executed and results reported. Validation failures are informational and should NOT halt execution.

**CRITICAL ID HANDLING RULES:**
- **NEVER hardcode any ID values** - not 1, not 2, not any number
- **NEVER assume an ID exists** or is valid
- **ALWAYS execute the proper setup sections** to get the actual IDs
- **ALWAYS use the variables** like `{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID}`, `{POTATOES_ID}`, etc.
- **NEVER skip setup sections** - if the runbook says execute Section 1, execute Section 1
- **NEVER substitute random values** for required parameters
- **This rule applies to EVERY SINGLE API CALL** in this runbook

**WASTAGE BASELINE (MANDATORY):**
- All test stock items MUST have `wastagePercentage = 0.0` at the item level
- Do NOT rely on store overrides for wastage in tests; keep overrides unset
- If an existing item has a non‚Äëzero wastage, update it to 0.0 before running tests

**Instruction:**
For every step or API call in this runbook, display a clear label or description of the task being executed before running the command. This ensures visibility into what is happening at each stage.

## Execution: FIFO DAG Suite

- Execute the DAGs below in order. Do not infer or reorder.
- Reuse the same `BRAND_ID` and `STORE_ID` across all DAGs in this run.
- Persist previously emitted variables (e.g., `POTATOES_ITEM_ID`, `POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID`) for later DAGs; only prompt if missing.
- Do not perform preflight checks or auto-login; the DAG `executor` flags control behavior.
- Halt on first failure and report per `_instructions.md`.

### DAG Invocation Protocol (MANDATORY)
- For each DAG path listed in Run Order, open the DAG file from disk and execute its JSON directly.
- Do NOT call any HTTP endpoint (e.g., `/dags/execute`) to run a DAG. There is no API for DAG execution.
- If a platform-specific DAG executor exists, use it to run the loaded JSON; otherwise, stop and report unavailability per `_instructions.md`.
- Between DAGs, retain the shared variable space so later DAGs can reuse emitted IDs; prompt only if a required variable is missing.

### Run Order
1. `AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json`
2. `AI/dags/Fifo-02-Sanitise-Test-Area.dag.json`
3. `AI/dags/Fifo-03-Setup-Test-Data.dag.json`
4. `AI/dags/Fifo-04-Validation.dag.json`

## DAG 1: Configuration - Prerequisites and Base Setup

**üö® MANDATORY STOP RULE: If ANY API call returns an error, 404, or unexpected response, IMMEDIATELY STOP execution and report the exact error. DO NOT continue to the next item. DO NOT move on to other sections. STOP and ask the user how to proceed. üö®**

This DAG verifies and creates all required entities for FIFO testing. Complete it before moving on.

### Execute DAG 1
- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json`.
- It will prompt for `BRAND_ID` and `STORE_ID` and then configure:
    - Unit of Measures: Each, Kilogram
    - Stock Categories: Vegetables, Soups
    - Supplier: TEST Supplier (isRegisteredForTax = false)
    - Subcount: Test Sub Count (not archived)
    - Stock Items: Potatoes (KG, Vegetables, wastage 0.0), Potatoe Soup (Each, Soups, wastage 0.0)
- Outputs: captures all resolved IDs for use in later sections.
- Re-runnable: safely checks-or-creates and updates wastage when needed.

## DAG 2: Environment Reset - Clean Testing Stage

**üö® MANDATORY EXECUTION PATTERN: MUST use itemIds filter in ALL queries. NEVER archive stock takes or GRVs without itemIds filter. üö®**

After completing DAG 1, execute the DAG `AI/dags/Fifo-02-Sanitise-Test-Area.dag.json` to ensure a clean test environment by removing any existing data for our test items only.

### Step: Archive Stock Takes Containing Test Items Only

**STEP 1:** Query for stock takes containing ONLY our test items:
```
GET /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes?itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}&isArchived=false
```

**STEP 2:** For each stock take returned in STEP 1, archive it:
```
PUT /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{STOCK_TAKE_ID}/archive
```

**MANDATORY SAFETY CHECK:** The query in STEP 1 MUST include `itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}` parameter. If this parameter is missing, STOP EXECUTION immediately.

### Step: Archive GRVs Containing Test Items Only

**STEP 1:** Query for GRVs containing ONLY our test items (no date filters):
```
GET /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs?itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}&isArchived=false
```
- **CRITICAL**: The itemIds parameter MUST be included to filter only GRVs with our test items

**STEP 2:** Collect GRV IDs from the response and archive them in bulk:
```
PUT /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/archive
```
Request body: `{"grvIds": [array of GRV IDs from STEP 1]}`

**MANDATORY SAFETY CHECK:** Only archive GRVs that were returned with the itemIds filter. NEVER archive all GRVs.

### Step: Verify Clean State
- **Check FIFO report returns empty for our test items:**
    - GET `/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/theoretical-stockonhand?items={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}`
    - Should return empty theoreticalSOH array, confirming no existing FIFO data for test items

## DAG 3: Setup Test Data (Deterministic)

### Execute DAG 3
- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-03-Setup-Test-Data.dag.json`.
- It will create deterministic test data only:
    - Create a single Stock Take at 7 days ago UTC, set Potatoes to 100.0 kg, post it
    - Create a GRV after that stock take for Potatoes and receive it
- Outputs: captures `STOCK_TAKE_1_ID`, `GRV_ID`, `GRV_ITEM_ID` for later use.

### Date Mapping (MANDATORY DISPLAY)
Before running the DAG, print the resolved dates (from current date) and label their usage:
- Stock Take date: `{7_DAYS_AGO}`
- GRV date: `{6_DAYS_AGO}` (receive uses `{6_DAYS_AGO_YYYYMMDDHHMMSS}`)

## DAG 4: FIFO Validation Testing

### Execute DAG 4
- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-04-Validation.dag.json`.
- This DAG performs comprehensive FIFO validation testing:
    - Tests Theoretical Stock On Hand reports with expected values
    - Creates closing stock take with 80kg remaining stock
    - Generates and validates Gross Profit reports with multi-layered FIFO calculations
    - Creates test discard data for spoilage testing
    - Generates and validates Stock Loss reports
- Expected validation results:
    - TSOH: opening=100, purchases=100, theoreticalSOH=200
    - GP Report: Multi-layered FIFO test (Opening=100kg@R150, Purchases=100kg@R300, Closing=80kg, Consumed=120kg@R210)
    - Stock Loss: spoilageUnits=5.0, spoilageValue=5.0, differenceValue=210.0
- All validation steps must pass to confirm FIFO calculations are working correctly

- **CRITICAL**: The AI assistant IS the DAG executor. You must open each DAG file from disk and execute each step manually.
- For each DAG path listed in Run Order, open the DAG file from disk and execute its JSON steps one by one.
- Do NOT call any HTTP endpoint (e.g., `/dags/execute`) to run a DAG. There is no API for DAG execution.
- You must interpret each DAG node and execute the corresponding API calls using the Cloud API MCP tools.
- Handle conditional logic (when clauses), variable substitution, and JSONPath selectors manually.
- Between DAGs, retain the shared variable space so later DAGs can reuse emitted IDs; prompt only if a required variable is missing.

    73‚Üí- Do not perform preflight checks or auto-login; the DAG `executor` flags control behavior.
    74‚Üí- Halt on first failure and report per `_instructions.md`.
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí### DAG Invocation Protocol (MANDATORY)
    77‚Üí- **CRITICAL**: The AI assistant IS the DAG executor. You must open each DAG file from disk and execute each step manually.
    78‚Üí- For each DAG path listed in Run Order, open the DAG file from disk and execute its JSON steps one by one.
    79‚Üí- Do NOT call any HTTP endpoint (e.g., `/dags/execute`) to run a DAG. There is no API for DAG execution.

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# FIFO Stock Management Testing Runbook

## üö® MANDATORY EXECUTION RULES - READ BEFORE STARTING üö®

**CRITICAL:** A stock take is NOT complete until all three steps are executed. An empty stock take or unposted stock take is useless for testing.

**CRITICAL SAFETY RULES:**
1. **ALWAYS use itemIds filter when querying stock takes**: `?itemIds=7313,7314&isArchived=false`
2. **NEVER execute archive operations without itemIds filter** 
3. **STOP IMMEDIATELY if any API call is missing required parameters**
4. **Each DAG MUST be completed before moving to the next DAG**
5. **If ANY step fails, STOP and report exact error - DO NOT CONTINUE**

**DEFAULT TEST VALUES (remove when testing complete):**
- Brand ID: 46
- Store ID: 10810
- Test Items: 7313 (Potatoes), 7314 (Potatoe Soup)

**MANDATORY DATE RULE:** 
- **CRITICAL**: When executing DAGs, ALWAYS use the dates specified in the DAG file defaults section, NOT dynamic dates
- If a DAG has hardcoded dates in its "defaults" section, those dates MUST be used exactly as specified
- Only use dynamic dates (7 days ago) if the DAG does NOT specify dates in defaults
- **FORMAT**: All dates must be in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.000Z

**MANDATORY SUMMARY:**
After each API endpoint call, print a brief summary indicating whether the call passed, if an entity already existed, or if it was created. This summary must be clear and concise, before moving to the next API call.

**Example format:**
- "‚úÖ Found existing 'Each' UOM with ID 68 - skipping creation"
- "‚úÖ Created new 'Vegetables' category with ID 123"
- "‚ùå API call failed: 404 Not Found"

**MANDATORY INSTRUCTION:**
This runbook must be executed in strict accordance with the protocols and formatting rules defined in `AI/Runbooks/_instructions.md`. Every instruction in that file is mandatory and must be followed 100%‚Äîno deviations, summarization, or interpretation are permitted. If any step or output format is unclear, refer to `_instructions.md` and adhere to it exactly.

**CRITICAL ERROR HANDLING:**
If ANY API call encounters an error, unexpected response, or failure:
1. HALT execution immediately 
2. Report the exact error message received
3. Report the exact API endpoint that failed
4. Report the exact request data sent
5. **CRITICAL**: If the error indicates connection failure (e.g., "connection refused", "target machine actively refused", "max retries exceeded"), immediately ask the user to verify that the Cloud API service is running and accessible
6. DO NOT attempt workarounds, retries, or alternative approaches
7. DO NOT continue to subsequent steps
8. Bring the issue to the user's attention for resolution
9. Wait for explicit user instruction before proceeding

**VALIDATION HANDLING:**
DAG validation steps should be executed and results reported. Validation failures are informational and should NOT halt execution.

**CRITICAL ID HANDLING RULES:**
- **NEVER hardcode any ID values** - not 1, not 2, not any number
- **NEVER assume an ID exists** or is valid
- **ALWAYS execute the proper setup sections** to get the actual IDs
- **ALWAYS use the variables** like `{TEST_SUBCOUNT_ID}`, `{POTATOES_ID}`, etc.
- **NEVER skip setup sections** - if the runbook says execute Section 1, execute Section 1
- **NEVER substitute random values** for required parameters
- **This rule applies to EVERY SINGLE API CALL** in this runbook

**WASTAGE BASELINE (MANDATORY):**
- All test stock items MUST have `wastagePercentage = 0.0` at the item level
- Do NOT rely on store overrides for wastage in tests; keep overrides unset
- If an existing item has a non‚Äëzero wastage, update it to 0.0 before running tests

**Instruction:**
For every step or API call in this runbook, display a clear label or description of the task being executed before running the command. This ensures visibility into what is happening at each stage.

## Execution: FIFO DAG Suite

- Execute the DAGs below in order. Do not infer or reorder.
- Reuse the same `BRAND_ID` and `STORE_ID` across all DAGs in this run.
- Persist previously emitted variables (e.g., `POTATOES_ITEM_ID`, `POTATOE_SOUP_ITEM_ID`) for later DAGs; only prompt if missing.
- Do not perform preflight checks or auto-login; the DAG `executor` flags control behavior.
- Halt on first failure and report per `_instructions.md`.

### DAG Invocation Protocol (MANDATORY)
- For each DAG path listed in Run Order, open the DAG file from disk and execute its JSON directly.
- Do NOT call any HTTP endpoint (e.g., `/dags/execute`) to run a DAG. There is no API for DAG execution.
- If a platform-specific DAG executor exists, use it to run the loaded JSON; otherwise, stop and report unavailability per `_instructions.md`.
- Between DAGs, retain the shared variable space so later DAGs can reuse emitted IDs; prompt only if a required variable is missing.

### Run Order
1. `AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json`
2. `AI/dags/Fifo-02-Sanitise-Test-Area.dag.json`
3. `AI/dags/Fifo-03-Setup-Test-Data.dag.json`
4. `AI/dags/Fifo-04-Validation.dag.json`

## DAG 1: Configuration - Prerequisites and Base Setup

**üö® MANDATORY STOP RULE: If ANY API call returns an error, 404, or unexpected response, IMMEDIATELY STOP execution and report the exact error. DO NOT continue to the next item. DO NOT move on to other sections. STOP and ask the user how to proceed. üö®**

This DAG verifies and creates all required entities for FIFO testing. Complete it before moving on.

### Execute DAG 1
- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-01-Data-Setup.dag.json`.
- It will prompt for `BRAND_ID` and `STORE_ID` and then configure:
    - Unit of Measures: Each, Kilogram
    - Stock Categories: Vegetables, Soups
    - Supplier: TEST Supplier (isRegisteredForTax = false)
    - Subcount: Test Sub Count (not archived)
    - Stock Items: Potatoes (KG, Vegetables, wastage 0.0), Potatoe Soup (Each, Soups, wastage 0.0)
- Outputs: captures all resolved IDs for use in later sections.
- Re-runnable: safely checks-or-creates and updates wastage when needed.

## DAG 2: Environment Reset - Clean Testing Stage

**üö® MANDATORY EXECUTION PATTERN: MUST use itemIds filter in ALL queries. NEVER archive stock takes or GRVs without itemIds filter. üö®**

After completing DAG 1, execute the DAG `AI/dags/Fifo-02-Sanitise-Test-Area.dag.json` to ensure a clean test environment by removing any existing data for our test items only.

### Step: Archive Stock Takes Containing Test Items Only

**STEP 1:** Query for stock takes containing ONLY our test items:
```
GET /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes?itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}&isArchived=false
```

**STEP 2:** For each stock take returned in STEP 1, archive it:
```
PUT /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/stocktakes/{STOCK_TAKE_ID}/archive
```

**MANDATORY SAFETY CHECK:** The query in STEP 1 MUST include `itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}` parameter. If this parameter is missing, STOP EXECUTION immediately.

### Step: Archive GRVs Containing Test Items Only

**STEP 1:** Query for GRVs containing ONLY our test items (no date filters):
```
GET /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs?itemIds={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}&isArchived=false
```
- **CRITICAL**: The itemIds parameter MUST be included to filter only GRVs with our test items

**STEP 2:** Collect GRV IDs from the response and archive them in bulk:
```
PUT /brands/{BRAND_ID}/stores/{STORE_ID}/grvs/archive
```
Request body: `{"grvIds": [array of GRV IDs from STEP 1]}`

**MANDATORY SAFETY CHECK:** Only archive GRVs that were returned with the itemIds filter. NEVER archive all GRVs.

### Step: Verify Clean State
- **Check FIFO report returns empty for our test items:**
    - GET `/stores/{STORE_ID}/reports/theoretical-stockonhand?items={POTATOES_ID},{POTATOE_SOUP_ID}`
    - Should return empty theoreticalSOH array, confirming no existing FIFO data for test items

## DAG 3: Setup Test Data (Deterministic)

### Execute DAG 3
- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-03-Setup-Test-Data.dag.json`.
- It will create deterministic test data only:
    - Create a single Stock Take at 7 days ago UTC, set Potatoes to 100.0 kg, post it
    - Create a GRV after that stock take for Potatoes and receive it
- Outputs: captures `STOCK_TAKE_1_ID`, `GRV_ID`, `GRV_ITEM_ID` for later use.

### Date Mapping (MANDATORY DISPLAY)
Before running the DAG, print the resolved dates (from current date) and label their usage:
- Stock Take date: `{7_DAYS_AGO}`
- GRV date: `{6_DAYS_AGO}` (receive uses `{6_DAYS_AGO_YYYYMMDDHHMMSS}`)

## DAG 4: FIFO Validation Testing

### Execute DAG 4
- Run the DAG: `AI/dags/Fifo-04-Validation.dag.json`.
- This DAG performs comprehensive FIFO validation testing:
    - Tests Theoretical Stock On Hand reports with expected values
    - Creates closing stock take with 80kg remaining stock
    - Generates and validates Gross Profit reports with multi-layered FIFO calculations
    - Creates test discard data for spoilage testing
    - Generates and validates Stock Loss reports
- Expected validation results:
    - TSOH: opening=100, purchases=100, theoreticalSOH=200
    - GP Report: Multi-layered FIFO test (Opening=100kg@R150, Purchases=100kg@R300, Closing=80kg, Consumed=120kg@R210)
    - Stock Loss: spoilageUnits=5.0, spoilageValue=5.0, differenceValue=210.0
- All validation steps must pass to confirm FIFO calculations are working correctly
